text.section: No insurance contract with a provider shall contain a most-favored-nation provision except where the commissioner determines that the market share of the insurer is nominal.

Nothing in this section shall be construed to prohibit a health insurer and a provider from negotiating payment rates and performance-based contract terms that would result in the health insurer receiving a rate that is as favorable, or more favorable, than the rates negotiated between a provider and other health insurance issuers.

law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 24, sec. 1233, effective July 15, 2010. -- Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 496, sec. 37, effective April 10, 1998.
